topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54af702e636872143d4c0e00#post_54af702e636872143d4c0e00

A croquette is a small breadcrumbed fried food roll containing, usually as main ingredients, mashed potatoes and/or ground meat (veal, beef, chicken, or turkey), shellfish, fish, cheese, vegetables, and mixed with bÃ©chamel or brown sauce,[1] and soaked white bread, egg, onion, spices and herbs, wine, milk, beer, or any of the combination thereof, sometimes with a filling, e.g. sauteed onions, mushrooms, or boiled eggs (Scotch eggs).
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54af702e636872143d4c0e00#post_54af702e636872143d4c0e00
It's basically potato and other ingredients mixed together, battered, and deep-fried.

topics.body:
The secret to most of the anti-LGBT movement lies within the main exponents. Be it politicians, or religious leaders.

If you see their backgrounds, chances are you'll find their experience with those groups isn't something pleasant, and stop me if you've heard this, but when you keep getting bad experiences from something, what does your brain immediately think? Exactly.

It's pretty much the same. People who had bad experiences or have been misinformed about the community are the ones that make that mistake.

As for the supporters, remember that Men in Black quote: Man is intelligent, people are morons.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
I just found the most depressing concept album ever.

Black Parade by MCR.

It's a rock opera about a man dying of cancer and lamenting his life. DOESNT THAT SOUND LIKE FUN KIDS!?

"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54af71566368727a20120500#post_54af71566368727a20120500
There's also the fact that people tend to remember the bad more than the good. So even if there good experiences, it's likely the bad will override.
topics.author: 500757fd7f123b75a90003b1
